channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Contrastive Semi-supervised Learning for Underwater Image Restoration via Reliable Bank
item.description: Despite the remarkable achievement of recent underwater image restoration techniques, the lack of labeled data has become a major hurdle for further progress.

item.title: A Framework for Real-time Object Detection and Image Restoration
item.description: In this paper, a two-stage framework for object detection and image restoration is proposed.

item.title: Extracting the Brain-like Representation by an Improved Self-Organizing Map for Image Classification
item.description: Backpropagation-based supervised learning has achieved great success in computer vision tasks.

item.title: WebSHAP: Towards Explaining Any Machine Learning Models Anywhere
item.description: As machine learning (ML) is increasingly integrated into our everyday Web experience, there is a call for transparent and explainable web-based ML.

item.title: EmotiEffNet Facial Features in Uni-task Emotion Recognition in Video at ABAW-5 competition
item.description: In this article, the results of our team for the fifth Affective Behavior Analysis in-the-wild (ABAW) competition are presented.

item.title: Cross-head Supervision for Crowd Counting with Noisy Annotations
item.description: To alleviate the negative impact of noisy annotations, we propose a novel crowd counting model with one convolution head and one transformer head, in which these two heads can supervise each other in noisy areas, called Cross-Head Supervision.

item.title: DIRE for Diffusion-Generated Image Detection
item.description: We find that existing detectors struggle to detect images generated by diffusion models, even if we include generated images from a specific diffusion model in their training data.

item.title: MixTeacher: Mining Promising Labels with Mixed Scale Teacher for Semi-Supervised Object Detection
item.description: Despite the remarkable progress made by modern detection models, this challenge is particularly evident in the semi-supervised case.

item.title: Depth-Aware Image Compositing Model for Parallax Camera Motion Blur
item.description: The (forward) model produces realistic motion blur from a single image, depth map, and camera trajectory.

item.title: Taming Diffusion Models for Audio-Driven Co-Speech Gesture Generation
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel diffusion-based framework, named Diffusion Co-Speech Gesture (DiffGesture), to effectively capture the cross-modal audio-to-gesture associations and preserve temporal coherence for high-fidelity audio-driven co-speech gesture generation.

item.title: Hybrid Spectral Denoising Transformer with Learnable Query
item.description: Challenges in adapting transformer for HSI arise from the capabilities to tackle existing limitations of CNN-based methods in capturing the global and local spatial-spectral correlations while maintaining efficiency and flexibility.

item.title: The Intel Neuromorphic DNS Challenge
item.description: A critical enabler for progress in neuromorphic computing research is the ability to transparently evaluate different neuromorphic solutions on important tasks and to compare them to state-of-the-art conventional solutions.

item.title: SurroundOcc: Multi-Camera 3D Occupancy Prediction for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Towards a more comprehensive perception of a 3D scene, in this paper, we propose a SurroundOcc method to predict the 3D occupancy with multi-camera images.

item.title: Diffusion-HPC: Generating Synthetic Images with Realistic Humans
item.description: Recent text-to-image generative models have exhibited remarkable abilities in generating high-fidelity and photo-realistic images.

item.title: Multi-modal Differentiable Unsupervised Feature Selection
item.description: Multi-modal high throughput biological data presents a great scientific opportunity and a significant computational challenge.

item.title: AU-aware graph convolutional network for Macro- and Micro-expression spotting
item.description: Automatic Micro-Expression (ME) spotting in long videos is a crucial step in ME analysis but also a challenging task due to the short duration and low intensity of MEs.

item.title: Improving Automated Hemorrhage Detection in Sparse-view Computed Tomography via Deep Convolutional Neural Network based Artifact Reduction
item.description: We evaluate the hemorrhage detectability in the predicted CCTs with a hemorrhage classification convolutional neural network, trained on fully sampled CCTs to detect and classify different sub-types of hemorrhages.

item.title: TemporalMaxer: Maximize Temporal Context with only Max Pooling for Temporal Action Localization
item.description: To this end, we introduce TemporalMaxer, which minimizes long-term temporal context modeling while maximizing information from the extracted video clip features with a basic, parameter-free, and local region operating max-pooling block.

item.title: Image Classifiers Leak Sensitive Attributes About Their Classes
item.description: Neural network-based image classifiers are powerful tools for computer vision tasks, but they inadvertently reveal sensitive attribute information about their classes, raising concerns about their privacy.

item.title: Image Enhancement for Remote Photoplethysmography in a Low-Light Environment
item.description: Using collected dataset, we found 1) face detection algorithm cannot detect faces in video captured in low light conditions; 2) A decrease in the amplitude of the pulsatile signal will lead to the noise signal to be in the dominant position; and 3) the chrominance-based method suffers from the limitation in the assumption about skin-tone will not hold, and Green and ICA method receive less influence than POS in dark illuminance environment.

item.title: Learning for Amalgamation: A Multi-Source Transfer Learning Framework For Sentiment Classification
item.description: Transfer learning plays an essential role in Deep Learning, which can remarkably improve the performance of the target domain, whose training data is not sufficient.

item.title: A New Benchmark: On the Utility of Synthetic Data with Blender for Bare Supervised Learning and Downstream Domain Adaptation
item.description: Moreover, we use the simulation-to-reality adaptation as a downstream task for comparing the transferability between synthetic and real data when used for pre-training, which demonstrates that synthetic data pre-training is also promising to improve real test results.

item.title: Large Selective Kernel Network for Remote Sensing Object Detection
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first time that large and selective kernel mechanisms have been explored in the field of remote sensing object detection.

item.title: CoLo-CAM: Class Activation Mapping for Object Co-Localization in Weakly-Labeled Unconstrained Videos
item.description: Although results are promising, objects are assumed to have minimal movement leading to degradation in performance for relatively long-term dependencies.

item.title: Tackling Clutter in Radar Data -- Label Generation and Detection Using PointNet++
item.description: Because there is no suitable public data set in which clutter is annotated, we design a method to automatically generate the respective labels.

item.title: ExoplANNET: A deep learning algorithm to detect and identify planetary signals in radial velocity data
item.description: In this work, a neural network is proposed to replace the computation of the significance of the signal detected with the radial velocity method and to classify it as of planetary origin or not.

item.title: PyVBMC: Efficient Bayesian inference in Python
item.description: PyVBMC is a Python implementation of the Variational Bayesian Monte Carlo (VBMC) algorithm for posterior and model inference for black-box computational models (Acerbi, 2018, 2020).

item.title: FindView: Precise Target View Localization Task for Look Around Agents
item.description: With the increase in demands for service robots and automated inspection, agents need to localize in its surrounding environment to achieve more natural communication with humans by shared contexts.

item.title: Hubs and Hyperspheres: Reducing Hubness and Improving Transductive Few-shot Learning with Hyperspherical Embeddings
item.description: Distance-based classification is frequently used in transductive few-shot learning (FSL).

item.title: Deep Metric Learning for Unsupervised Remote Sensing Change Detection
item.description: This loss is motivated by the principle of metric learning where we simultaneously maximize the distance between change pair-wise pixels while minimizing the distance between no-change pair-wise pixels in bi-temporal image domain and their deep feature domain.

item.title: Achieving a Better Stability-Plasticity Trade-off via Auxiliary Networks in Continual Learning
item.description: In contrast to the natural capabilities of humans to learn new tasks in a sequential fashion, neural networks are known to suffer from catastrophic forgetting, where the model's performances on old tasks drop dramatically after being optimized for a new task.

item.title: Identifiability Results for Multimodal Contrastive Learning
item.description: Our work generalizes previous identifiability results by redefining the generative process in terms of distinct mechanisms with modality-specific latent variables.

item.title: Combining Distance to Class Centroids and Outlier Discounting for Improved Learning with Noisy Labels
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new approach for addressing the challenge of training machine learning models in the presence of noisy labels.

item.title: Effectively Modeling Time Series with Simple Discrete State Spaces
item.description: For expressivity, we propose a new SSM parameterization based on the companion matrix -- a canonical representation for discrete-time processes -- which enables SpaceTime's SSM layers to learn desirable autoregressive processes.

item.title: Learning Logic Specifications for Soft Policy Guidance in POMCP
item.description: In this paper, we use inductive logic programming to learn logic specifications from traces of POMCP executions, i. e., sets of belief-action pairs generated by the planner.

item.title: Dataflow graphs as complete causal graphs
item.description: Component-based development is one of the core principles behind modern software engineering practices.

item.title: Towards Robust Bangla Complex Named Entity Recognition
item.description: Named Entity Recognition (NER) is a fundamental task in natural language processing that involves identifying and classifying named entities in text.

item.title: FateZero: Fusing Attentions for Zero-shot Text-based Video Editing
item.description: We also have a better zero-shot shape-aware editing ability based on the text-to-video model.

item.title: Learning Spatio-Temporal Aggregations for Large-Scale Capacity Expansion Problems
item.description: We evaluate aggregation outcomes over a range of hyperparameters governing the loss function and compare resulting upper bounds on the original problem with those obtained using benchmark methods.

item.title: Lane Graph as Path: Continuity-preserving Path-wise Modeling for Online Lane Graph Construction
item.description: We present a path-based online lane graph construction method, termed LaneGAP, which end-to-end learns the path and recovers the lane graph via a Path2Graph algorithm.

item.title: Statistical learning on measures: an application to persistence diagrams
item.description: We consider a binary supervised learning classification problem where instead of having data in a finite-dimensional Euclidean space, we observe measures on a compact space $\mathcal{X}$.

item.title: Cascading and Direct Approaches to Unsupervised Constituency Parsing on Spoken Sentences
item.description: The goal is to determine the spoken sentences' hierarchical syntactic structure in the form of constituency parse trees, such that each node is a span of audio that corresponds to a constituent.

item.title: Watch or Listen: Robust Audio-Visual Speech Recognition with Visual Corruption Modeling and Reliability Scoring
item.description: Thus, we firstly analyze that the previous AVSR models are not indeed robust to the corruption of multimodal input streams, the audio and the visual inputs, compared to uni-modal models.

item.title: Dually Enhanced Propensity Score Estimation in Sequential Recommendation
item.description: According to the graph, two complementary propensity scores are estimated from the views of item and user, respectively, based on the same set of user feedback data.

item.title: Graph-less Collaborative Filtering
item.description: Motivated by these limitations, we propose a simple and effective collaborative filtering model (SimRec) that marries the power of knowledge distillation and contrastive learning.

item.title: Deep Learning Weight Pruning with RMT-SVD: Increasing Accuracy and Reducing Overfitting
item.description: Recently, random matrix theory (RMT) has been applied to the overfitting problem in deep learning.

item.title: Predicting Individualized Effects of Internet-Based Treatment for Genito-Pelvic Pain/Penetration Disorder: Development and Internal Validation of a Multivariable Decision Tree Model
item.description: In this study, we developed and internally validated a multivariable decision tree model that predicts effects of an internet-based treatment on a multidimensional composite score of GPPPD symptoms.

item.title: MAtch, eXpand and Improve: Unsupervised Finetuning for Zero-Shot Action Recognition with Language Knowledge
item.description: We adapt a VL model for zero-shot and few-shot action recognition using a collection of unlabeled videos and an unpaired action dictionary.

item.title: DiffusionAD: Denoising Diffusion for Anomaly Detection
item.description: We introduce a new pipeline, DiffusionAD, to anomaly detection.

item.title: Stochastic Segmentation with Conditional Categorical Diffusion Models
item.description: Semantic segmentation has made significant progress in recent years thanks to deep neural networks, but the common objective of generating a single segmentation output that accurately matches the image's content may not be suitable for safety-critical domains such as medical diagnostics and autonomous driving.
